types.name: Query
types.description: The entry type for GraphQL queries.

fields.name: node
fields.description: Fetches an object given its globally unique `ID`.

args.name: id
args.description: The `ID` of the node.

fields.name: searchPosts
fields.description: Returns posts containing a given search term.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: The order the resulting items should be returned in. This argument is also important as it is used in creating pagination cursors. This value’s default is the primary key for the object.

args.name: first
args.description: The top `n` items in the set to be returned. Can’t be used with `last`.

args.name: last
args.description: The bottom `n` items in the set to be returned. Can’t be used with `first`.

args.name: before
args.description: Constrains the set to nodes *before* this cursor in the specified ordering.

args.name: after
args.description: Constrains the set to nodes *after* this cursor in the specified ordering.

args.name: offset
args.description: An integer offset representing how many items to skip in the set.

args.name: descending
args.description: If `true` the nodes will be in descending order, if `false` the items will be in ascending order. `false` by default.

fields.name: person
fields.description: Queries a single `Person` using its primary keys.

args.name: id
args.description: The `ID` of the `Person` node.

fields.name: personByRowId
fields.description: Queries a single `Person` using a uniqueness constraint with field `rowId`.

args.name: rowId
args.description: The exact value of the `rowId` field to match.

fields.name: personNodes
fields.description: Queries and returns a set of items with some metatadata for `Person`. Note that cursors will not work across different `orderBy` values. If you want to reuse a cursor, make sure you don’t change `orderBy`.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: The order the resulting items should be returned in. This argument is also important as it is used in creating pagination cursors. This value’s default is the primary key for the object.

args.name: first
args.description: The top `n` items in the set to be returned. Can’t be used with `last`.

args.name: last
args.description: The bottom `n` items in the set to be returned. Can’t be used with `first`.

args.name: before
args.description: Constrains the set to nodes *before* this cursor in the specified ordering.

args.name: after
args.description: Constrains the set to nodes *after* this cursor in the specified ordering.

args.name: offset
args.description: An integer offset representing how many items to skip in the set.

args.name: descending
args.description: If `true` the nodes will be in descending order, if `false` the items will be in ascending order. `false` by default.

args.name: rowId
args.description: Filters the resulting set with an equality test on the `rowId` field.

args.name: givenName
args.description: Filters the resulting set with an equality test on the `givenName` field.

args.name: familyName
args.description: Filters the resulting set with an equality test on the `familyName` field.

args.name: about
args.description: Filters the resulting set with an equality test on the `about` field.

args.name: createdAt
args.description: Filters the resulting set with an equality test on the `createdAt` field.

args.name: updatedAt
args.description: Filters the resulting set with an equality test on the `updatedAt` field.

fields.name: postByRowId

args.name: rowId
args.description: The exact value of the `rowId` field to match.

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: A single entry query for the advanced data client Relay. Nothing special at all, if you don’t know what this field is for, you probably don’t need it.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Node
types.description: A single node object in the graph with a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The `Node`’s globally unique identifier used to refetch the node.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: PostOrdering
types.description: Properties with which `Post` can be ordered.

enumValues.name: ROW_ID
enumValues.description: The primary key for the post.

enumValues.name: AUTHOR_ID
enumValues.description: The id of the author user.

enumValues.name: HEADLINE
enumValues.description: The title written by the user.

enumValues.name: TOPIC
enumValues.description: The topic this has been posted in.

enumValues.name: BODY
enumValues.description: The main body text of our post.

enumValues.name: CREATED_AT
enumValues.description: The time this post was created.

enumValues.name: UPDATED_AT
enumValues.description: The latest time this post was updated.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Cursor
types.description: An opaque base64 encoded string describing a location in a list of items.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: PostConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of `Post` items

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination of type `Post`.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: All of the items available to be queried in this connection.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: The queried list of `Post`.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A single item and a cursor to aid in pagination.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: Are there items after our result set to be queried?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: Are there items before our result set to be queried?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: The cursor for the first item in the list.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: The cursor for the last item in the list.

types.name: Post
types.description: A forum post written by a user.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier for this `Post`.

fields.name: rowId
fields.description: The primary key for the post.

fields.name: authorId
fields.description: The id of the author user.

fields.name: headline
fields.description: The title written by the user.

fields.name: topic
fields.description: The topic this has been posted in.

fields.name: body
fields.description: The main body text of our post.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time this post was created.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The latest time this post was updated.

fields.name: summary
fields.description: A truncated version of the body for summaries.

fields.name: personByAuthorId
fields.description: Queries a single `Person` node related to the `Post` type.

types.name: Date
types.description: Some time value

types.name: Person
types.description: A user of the forum.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier for this `Person`.

fields.name: rowId
fields.description: The primary key for the person.

fields.name: givenName
fields.description: The person’s first name.

fields.name: familyName
fields.description: The person’s last name.

fields.name: about
fields.description: A short description about the user, written by the user.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time this person was created.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The latest time this person was updated.

fields.name: fullName
fields.description: A person’s full name including their first and last name.

fields.name: latestPost
fields.description: Get’s the latest post written by the person.

fields.name: postNodesByAuthorId
fields.description: Queries and returns a set of `Post` nodes that are related to the `Person` source node.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: The order the resulting items should be returned in. This argument is also important as it is used in creating pagination cursors. This value’s default is the primary key for the object.

args.description: The top `n` items in the set to be returned. Can’t be used with `last`.

args.name: last
args.description: The bottom `n` items in the set to be returned. Can’t be used with `first`.

args.name: before
args.description: Constrains the set to nodes *before* this cursor in the specified ordering.

args.name: after
args.description: Constrains the set to nodes *after* this cursor in the specified ordering.

args.name: offset
args.description: An integer offset representing how many items to skip in the set.

args.name: descending
args.description: If `true` the nodes will be in descending order, if `false` the items will be in ascending order. `false` by default.

args.name: rowId
args.description: Filters the resulting set with an equality test on the `rowId` field.

args.name: headline
args.description: Filters the resulting set with an equality test on the `headline` field.

args.name: topic
args.description: Filters the resulting set with an equality test on the `topic` field.

args.name: body
args.description: Filters the resulting set with an equality test on the `body` field.

args.name: createdAt
args.description: Filters the resulting set with an equality test on the `createdAt` field.

args.name: updatedAt
args.description: Filters the resulting set with an equality test on the `updatedAt` field.

types.name: PostEdge
types.description: An edge in the `PostConnection`.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: The cursor describing the position of the edge’s associated node.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

fields.name: id
fields.description: An identifier for the viewer node. Just the plain string “viewer.” Can be used to refetch the viewer object in the `node` field. This is required for Relay.

types.name: Mutation
types.description: The entry type for GraphQL mutations.

fields.name: registerPerson
fields.description: Register a person in our forum.

fields.name: insertPerson
fields.description: Creates a new node of the `Person` type.

fields.name: updatePerson
fields.description: Updates a single node of type `Person`.

fields.name: deletePerson
fields.description: Deletes a single node of type `Person`.

fields.name: insertPost
fields.description: Creates a new node of the `Post` type.

fields.name: updatePost
fields.description: Updates a single node of type `Post`.

fields.name: deletePost
fields.description: Deletes a single node of type `Post`.

types.name: RegisterPersonInput
types.description: The input object for the `registerPerson` procedure.

inputFields.name: clientMutationId
inputFields.description: An optional mutation ID for client’s to use in tracking mutations. This field has no meaning to the server and is simply returned as is.

types.name: RegisterPersonPayload
types.description: The payload returned by the `registerPerson`

fields.name: output
fields.description: The actual value returned by `registerPerson`

fields.name: clientMutationId
fields.description: If the mutation was passed a `clientMutationId` in the input object this is the exact same value echoed back.

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: A single entry query for the advanced data client Relay. Nothing special at all, if you don’t know what this field is for, you probably don’t need it.

types.name: Payload
types.description: The payload of any mutation which contains a few important fields.

types.name: UpdatePersonInput
types.description: Locates the `Person` node to update and specifies some new field values. Primary key fields are required to be able to locate the node to update.

inputFields.name: rowId
inputFields.description: Matches the `rowId` field of the node.

inputFields.name: newRowId
inputFields.description: Updates the node’s `rowId` field with this new value.

inputFields.name: newGivenName
inputFields.description: Updates the node’s `givenName` field with this new value.

inputFields.name: newFamilyName
inputFields.description: Updates the node’s `familyName` field with this new value.

inputFields.name: newAbout
inputFields.description: Updates the node’s `about` field with this new value.

inputFields.name: newCreatedAt
inputFields.description: Updates the node’s `createdAt` field with this new value.

inputFields.name: newUpdatedAt
inputFields.description: Updates the node’s `updatedAt` field with this new value.

inputFields.name: clientMutationId
inputFields.description: An optional mutation ID for client’s to use in tracking mutations. This field has no meaning to the server and is simply returned as is.

fields.description: The deleted `Post` id.

fields.name: clientMutationId
fields.description: If the mutation was passed a `clientMutationId` in the input object this is the exact same value echoed back.

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: A single entry query for the advanced data client Relay. Nothing special at all, if you don’t know what this field is for, you probably don’t need it.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
